Butterfly wings CFD simulation

Simulation of butterfly flapping with the method of dipole domains

Numerical method of dipole domains

Numerical scheme:

The dipole particles interaction:

Computing cycle

  1. Calculation of the dipole moments of the attached particles satisfying the boundary conditions n*V = n*Vs.
  2. The calculation of the particles velocity.
  3. Calculation of changes in the dipole moments as a result of particles interactions
  4. Displacement of the particles, including particles at the trailing edge

The force calculation

I is the hydrodynamic impulse of the fluid

Testing of the method

The flow around the thin unmoving plate:

The butterfly model


Time dependencies of the force coefficients and the angles

Dependence of the drag force coefficient on the phase shift

Dependencies of the average values Cx, Cy on the attack angle and the opening angle

Scheme of the forces and accelerations directions in different oscillation phase

Conclusion

  • The mesh-free dipole particles-based methods is developed and applied for simulation of the insect flapping wings.
  • It is shown that the main cause of the thrust performance is interaction of wings with an added mass of fluid at the wings acceleration.

The wake behind the plate performing angular oscillations
